fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Every equivalence relation in a topos is effective

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: An equivalence relation in a cartesian category is said to be effective if it is the kernel pair of some morphism. An effective category is a cartesian category in which every equivalence relation is effective.
Let (a,b) \colon R \rightarrowtail A \times A be a relation in a cartesian category. (a,b) is said to be an equivalence relation if it is reflexive, symmetric, and transitive.
Let A be any object in a topos and let \{ \} \colon A \to \Omega ^{A} be the name of the diagonal relation \Delta \colon A \rightarrowtail A \times A. \{ \} is a monomorphism.
